Package me.dessie.dessielib.inventoryapi

Class InventoryBuilder

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.inventoryapi.InventoryBuilder
public class InventoryBuilder extends Object
Builder for creating Inventories with InventoryAPI.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description

    InventoryBuilder(InventoryBuilder builder, boolean pages)
    Creates a complete copy of this Inventory.

  • Constructor Details

    • InventoryBuilder

      public InventoryBuilder(int size, String name)
      Creates an empty Inventory with a size and title.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the Inventory, should be divisible by 9 and no larger than 54.
      name - The name of the Inventory.

    • InventoryBuilder

      public InventoryBuilder(InventoryBuilder builder)
      Parameters:
      builder - The InventoryBuilder to copy. Pages will not be copied.

    • InventoryBuilder

      public InventoryBuilder(InventoryBuilder builder, boolean pages)
      Creates a complete copy of this Inventory.
      Parameters:
      builder - The InventoryBuilder to copy.
      pages - If pages should be copied

      If the player can close the Inventory

    • getCurrentPage

      public int getCurrentPage()
      Returns:
      The current page this Inventory is viewing

    • open

      public InventoryBuilder open(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Opens an InventoryBuilder for the Player. If an InventoryBuilder is opened for multiple players, only the last player will be tracked within this object. The Inventory will be updated for all players when it is modified. If you need to have a per-player inventory, you use InventoryBuilder(InventoryBuilder) to create a copy.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to open this inventory for
      Returns:
      The InventoryBuilder

    • close

      public InventoryBuilder close(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Forcefully closes the Inventory.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to close
      Returns:
      The InventoryBuilder

    • setName

      public InventoryBuilder setName(String name)
      Note: The Inventory title will not update unless it is reopened.
      Parameters:
      name - The new name of this InventoryBuilder
      Returns:
      The InventoryBuilder

    • setSize

      public InventoryBuilder setSize(int size)
      Note: The Inventory size will not update unless it is reopened.
      Parameters:
      size - The new size of this InventoryBuilder
      Returns:
      The InventoryBuilder

    • setPreventsClose

      public InventoryBuilder setPreventsClose(boolean preventClose)
      When true, the InventoryBuilder cannot be closed by the player. for manually closing the Inventory.
      Parameters:
      preventClose - Whether the player can or cannot close the Inventory
      Returns:
      The InventoryBuilder

    • addItem

      public ItemBuilder addItem(ItemBuilder item)
      Adds the item into the first empty slot into the Inventory. Returns null if the inventory is full.
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemBuilder to place into the inventory
      Returns:
      The ItemBuilder that was placed, or null if it could not be placed.

    • addItem

      public ItemBuilder addItem(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Adds the item into the first empty slot into the Inventory. Returns null if the inventory is full.
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemStack to place into the inventory
      Returns:
      The generated ItemBuilder that was placed, or null if it could not be placed.

    • addItemsAndPages

      public InventoryBuilder addItemsAndPages(List<ItemBuilder> items)
      Adds ALL items into the InventoryBuilder. If the current page is full, the InventoryBuilder will be copied and items will begin to be placed there.
      Parameters:
      items - A list of ItemBuilders to place into the inventory
      Returns:
      The InventoryBuilder

    • setItem

      public ItemBuilder setItem(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item, int slot)
      Sets an ItemStack in a specific slot, regardless of if the slot is empty. Passing null as the item will clear the slot.
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemStack to add.
      slot - The slot to set the item in
      Returns:
      The placed ItemBuilder.

    • setItem

      public ItemBuilder setItem(ItemBuilder item, int slot)
      Sets an ItemBuilder in a specific slot, regardless of if the slot is empty. Passing null as the item will clear the slot.
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemBuilder to add.
      slot - The slot to set the item in
      Returns:
      The placed ItemBuilder.

    • setItems

      public InventoryBuilder setItems(ItemBuilder item, Integer... slots)
      Sets an ItemBuilder in multiple slots, regardless of if the slots are empty.
      Parameters:
      item - The ItemBuilder to add.
      slots - The slots to place the ItemBuilder into.
      Returns:
      The InventoryBuilder.

    • organize

      public InventoryBuilder organize(boolean byItems)
      Shifts all the items to the top most left position possible.
      Parameters:
      byItems - If the inventory should be sorted by Material, alphabetically, and by stack size.
      Returns:
      The InventoryBuilder

    • findFirst

      public ItemBuilder findFirst(ItemBuilder item)
      Finds the first instance of an ItemBuilder
      Parameters:

    • findFirst

      public ItemBuilder findFirst(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)

      Parameters:
      item - The ItemBuilder to look for that has the required ItemStack.
      Returns:
      The found ItemBuilder, or null if it doesn't exist within the Inventory.

    • findFirst

      Finds the first instance of an ItemBuilder with the specified Material
      Parameters:
      material - The ItemBuilder to look for that has the required Material.
      Returns:
      The found ItemBuilder, or null if it doesn't exist within the Inventory.

    • addPage

      public InventoryBuilder addPage(InventoryBuilder builder)
      Adds an InventoryBuilder as a page to this InventoryBuilder Page arrows will automatically be set on the bottom corner slots.
      Parameters:
      builder - The builder to add.
      Returns:
      The original InventoryBuilder

    • addPage

      public InventoryBuilder addPage(int size, String name)
      Adds an InventoryBuilder as a page to this InventoryBuilder Page arrows will automatically be set on the bottom corner slots.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the new InventoryBuilder.
      name - The name of the new InventoryBuilder.
      Returns:
      The original InventoryBuilder

    • getPage

      Parameters:
      page - The page to get
      Returns:

    • getInventories

      public static Map<org.bukkit.entity.Player,InventoryBuilder> getInventories()

      Returns:
      A Player -> InventoryBuilder map of all opened InventoryBuilders.
